Introduction

ondreian
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 5:47:47 PM

Welcome

There seems to be a lot of new users showing up, which is great.

we welcome you

Who

I've seen a fair amount of speculation on LNet as to who is controlling these forums. I am the creator/admin (my PC handle is m444w if you are unaware). I currently have given two community members moderator access: @Whirlin and @horibu because of their track records as being standup individuals in dealing with the community.

Here is a few things to keep in mind: 1. this is not the PC. We have a Code of Conduct for participating in our community. Generally if you are respectful of the dignity of all of your fellow humans, especially when expressing differences of opinion, you will be fine. 2. these are not your grand-pappy's forums. They are feature rich, and i'm sure it will take awhile for us all to get use to them. If there is anything obviously buggy or problematic, feel free to PM myself or one of the moderators. 3. There is likely to be some growing pains while we are all figuring this out. If you have questions or concerns, feel free to PM me or reach out to me on Discord/Slack/LNet/AIM/here.

Features

  1. Markdown markdown is a powerful syntax to write formatted text, you can read more on it on the cheatsheet or on the official documentation. Due to security concerns, you cannot use the raw HTML feature spoken about on either of those documents. There are several scripts that allow you to dump items to .csv files and upload them to Google spreadsheets, you can also export these to tables to easily generate a wonderful markdown post using several online tools. this is one i use to generate markdown tables from item spreadsheets

  2. Tags tags are another powerful feature of this forum, and they can help people quickly find relevant info and are more akin to custom topics. please be respectful with tag creation, so they still retain their power, where possible prefer singular tag names such as weapon and armor versus weapons and armors or announcement vs announcements

  3. Alt Accounts Do not create alt accounts. Please maintain one identity on these forums, namely one that people can find you with. If someone is harassing you, then they are violating the CoC (code of conduct)

  4. GameMasters Please be respectful of GameMasters, they are essentially unpaid volunteers that provide us with a labor of love. You can critique work, but never demean a person. GMs are humans too.

Mogonis
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 6:19:33 PM

The @ symbol.

ondreian
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 6:20:56 PM

Only the creator of a topic can add a tag to that topic, @ is for mentioning other users. There is an input at the bottom of the "Composer" view where it says something like "add up to N tags" where you can do it.
